channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023060396
item.description:
Report E-2023060396

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-10
  • City: OZARK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The 4 5 gal. Poly Jerry Cans were placed on a pallet and not secured what so ever. A single plastic Jerry Can fell over while in-transit allowing 2.5 Gal. of the material to be released to the trailer floor from the removable screw on cap.

item.title: Report X-2023060296
item.description:
Report X-2023060296

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At some point during transit to the destination facility the package was dropped causing a small puncture in the jerrican. This caused leakage. There was an inner plastic bag that contained the spillage. Proper PPE was use and the package was placed in a Hazmat bag and drum. DescribePack: Very small puncture not visible by sight. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Hazmat bag and drum.

item.title: Report X-2023060187
item.description:
Report X-2023060187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was not properly labeled and was sent up through the overhead sorter. Top split called for Q to notify that they had sent it down th QA chute as a leaking package. At time of discover, the package was safely contained in a Hazmat bag and container and set aside until the end of the sort. DescribePack: Box was stained, inside packaging was greatly stained and the glass bottle was wet with residual leaked material. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Placed undefined package in hazmat bag and damage toat. research safety data sheet. set is safe location for post sort processing

item.title: Report I-2023050118
item.description:
Report I-2023050118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: Little Rock
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noticed outside of trailer wet when he arrived at the Little Rock service center. When the trailer was opened they found the empty drum with a punture in the bottom side about one inch in length. The drum was contained and sand put down to contain material.

item.title: Report X-2023050408
item.description:
Report X-2023050408

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, one paper bag of fifty bags on a pallet, of the above described hazardous material was found damaged. It appeared the damage occurred when the bag caught on a strap when it was loaded onto the trailer. Approximately three pounds of the dry substance spilled on to trailer floor. Spill has been cleaned and all damaged material was left in a salvage pail at OSandD.
